CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 5, 1946, pg. 14, reads: "Vivian Davidson."  Portion of accompanying "'Round Town" column by Alma Polk reads: "Holiday Hangovers - Two popular Pittsburghers spent their holidays in the South.  Petite Vivian Ann Davidson of the Wylie Avenue Branch Library took advantage of her five days vacation to fly to Jacksonville, Fla., and visited a friend, Wilhelmina Owens. 'Billy' wrote, 'don't bring anything for the inside - our time will be spent in the wide open spaces.'  And Vivian confessed it's the thrill of her life to be able to go so far by plane..."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vivian Davidson Hewitt posed seated backwards on Helene Curtis chair, in front of dark curtain, Harris Studio
